description:
Investing.com, the leading global financial news & data platform, is on the lookout for a Junior Marketing Analyst to join our team and create, analyze, and optimize large-scale campaigns.
What you’ll be doing:
Hands-on campaign management on various ad networks and platforms
Build and maintain strategic relationships with key acquisition partners
Collaborate with different teams members within the marketing department to deliver and execute successful mobile marketing campaigns
Provide complete performance reporting and analysis on all device marketing campaigns and take relevant action on insights gained.
Establish, implement and measure the effectiveness of acquisition initiatives
What you’ll bring:
University Graduate - Industrial Engineering or Business Management/Economics
Strong analytical skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
SQL capabilities
Proficiency with Excel
Ability to manipulate and analyze large quantities of data and present it in reports
High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing for priorities simultaneously
Strong organizational, analytical, presentation, and problem-solving skills
Fluent English - verbal and written
Self-motivated and meticulous, with a creative and resourceful mind, bright, proactive, works well independently and as part of a team
Who we are:
Investing.com was founded in 2007 and now has over 350 employees across the world.
With 60 million monthly unique visitors, 4 billion page views, over 500 million sessions, and over 300,000 financial instruments covered, Investing.com is one of the top two global financial websites.
Investing.com offers unlimited access to cutting-edge financial market tools such as real-time quotes and charts, customized portfolios, personal live alerts, calendars, calculators, and financial insights, completely free of charge. In addition to the global stock markets, Investing.com also covers world indices, ETFs, commodities, bonds & interest rates, cryptocurrencies, futures, and options“. Investing.com strives to be a one-stop-shop for traders and investors with apps available.
What we offer:
A chance to join one of the leading financial markets platforms worldwide
Challenging assignments in a local and international environment
Enjoy excellent benefits and a high-energy working environment
As with all investing.com positions - we're looking for someone who is self-motivated and meticulous, with a creative and resourceful mind, bright, proactive, and works well independently and as part of a team.
Check out openings on our brand new career website: https://www.investing-careers.com/
Our Privacy Policy: Your resume and information will be kept confidential

Employment Type:

EmployeeShow more Report

About Agmatix
agmatix’s vision is to create best of class sustainable agriculture for the future by making high quality and standardized agronomic data freely available for ag professionals to translate into impact. To do that, agmatix is building a leading digital field trials technology that is revolutionizing data driven agriculture. Our technology disrupts a domain where lack of common language, connectivity and data curation methodologies are significant barriers for improvements. Implementing agmatix solutions will allow agricultural professionals around the world to increase crops yields while reducing environmental damage and improving crop quality over time.
agmatix is built on a set of 6 core values, we are proud to say we stick to the following:
Cutting Edge- Constant state of mind to improve, grow and learn
Daring- We strive to change the world with the best solutions, Reshaping the future of agriculture.
Data-Driven- We live and breathe data-driven decisions in everything we do.
Determination- We strive to change the world with the best solutions
Rooted- The fabric of our DNA is connected to the principles that matter to our clients, our people, and the planet
Trustworthy- We are a source of confidence to our clients, our employees, partners, and colleagues
About the Role
Do you want to help us take our product marketing to the next level? Do you want to bring an innovative, data-driven approach to demand generation techniques, digital strategies, and field marketing? Do you want to elevate our brand and gain market share? If so, then we're looking for you!
We're looking for a Marketing Manager who will report directly to the VP of Marketing. As a Marketing Manager at agmatix, you'll be part of an exciting team that works together to drive our business forward. We encourage creativity and innovation—and we appreciate hard work!
We are looking for someone with experience in marketing with a focus on product marketing and sales enablement.
You will develop and oversee all things related to our products and coordinate with external agencies in a variety of areas such as website, digital marketing, social media, etc.
The ideal candidate will have worked in a SaaS company focusing on B2B enterprise customers and have experience with supporting several products/solutions.
What You will do?You will work cross-functionally with the sales, product, and agronomy teams to align messaging to better position our solutions to our target personas and impact the success of inbound and outbound marketing.You will create content to educate internal and external stakeholders on product features and benefits.You will support the Sales team by preparing custom-made product marketing materials for the different segments and pipeline life cycle needs. This includes email templates, PPTs, RPF templates, etc.You will create content for assets such as blogs, power points, solution briefs, white papers, email newsletters, and website copy in coordination with our internal experts and external agency vendors. You will need a strong ability to take a concept or idea and turn it into reality.You will define, analyze, and optimize the metrics of success for paid media campaigns based on the performance of account KPIs, data-driven reporting, and managing budgetary goals. Work with your manager to bring the most effective ads to market.You will manage campaigns for mobile app advertising in key media outlets and paid channels for our market segments.You will identify key events and execute logistics and planning related to personnel, budget, and projected ROI for lead generation and brand awareness goals.You will work closely with agency partners to monitor website traffic, revise content, and optimize SEO.You will partner with a PR agency on industry-related topics and key initiatives.
About YouYou are seasoned professional and have an experience in B2B marketing, ideally in a high-growth startup company.You gain strong mobile app marketing experience.You have a SaaS industry experience, with an understanding of the evolving digital marketing landscape and specific needs to market software solutions.You have strong proficiency in Google Analytics, Google Ads, and LinkedIn Ads.You gain proven record of successful budget management and management of advertising channels to meet target KPIs thresholds necessary for the business’ success.You are highly data-driven marketer with a proven track record of delivering initiatives that help achieve overall company goals.Ability to deep dive and learn new domains, technology fields, products, and solutions.You have an exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written.Have the ability to multitask, change priorities rapidly and work under pressure.You gain an experience in agency relationships and management.You are a self-starter with strong project management skills is a must.If you have agriculture or food industry experience it is preferred.Proficient in PowerPoint, WordPress, Canva, Figma, Monday, Slack, and other tools.Show more Report

Imagen is developing a disruptive technology for the professional photo editing market. We use edited photos from each of our users, to create personalized AI profiles and to reduce and eliminate editing efforts. Creating a personalized profile based on user data gives great value to our users and creates many challenges.With a very strong market validation, a crazy month-over-month growth, and a top-tier VC backing us, we’re looking for the first team members to join our team. It’s an opportunity to be part of something huge and be a leader in a fast-growing company.What will you do:Lead the marketing data activities in the companyAnalysis and decision-making based on data insightsVisualize data with dashboards to address key questions for the company’s in-house teams like Marketing, Growth, Product, and moreDesign and execute BI ETL flowsRequirements:BA / BSc in Industrial Engineering and Management / Information Systems / Engineering / Economics / Statistics / Mathematics / similar background.3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst / BI Analyst / similar positions2+ years of experience with B2C data-driven productsStrong SQL experience querying large, complex data setsExperience in building BI visualizations and dashboards (Tableau – an advantage)Knowledge of Python for data prep and analysis – an advantageJob Type: Full-timeShow more Report

DESCRIPTION
SuperCom is seeking an experienced leader to join our executive team as VP Sales & Marketing. We are looking for someone who can thrive in a results and performance-based culture and brings an exceptional combination of strategic understanding, drive, persistence, and execution. You will report to the CEO and lead the company’s sales and marketing department across all global regions and our 3 business units– IoT, Cyber and eGov.
As part of this role, you will develop the company’s worldwide sales and marketing strategy, forecast sales volumes and oversee the department’s day-to-day activities.
Responsibilities:
Lead our global sales and marketing teams with set annual quotas and goals.
Design and oversee marketing campaigns, including production of marketing collateral and messaging content.
Influence, collaborate and work with cross-functional leaders, departments, and teams to develop and execute successful strategies.
Monitor customer, market and competitor activity and provide feedback to company leadership team and other company functions.
Coach, grow and develop employees on a regular basis to build a dynamic sales and marketing organization.

REQUIREMENTS
At least 15 years of sales experience with complex tech solutions and products.5 years of experience managing a sales and marketing team.5 years of experience in government sales to customers in North America and Europe.5 years of experience in direct sales with a personal quota.Proven experience leading a company’s sales and marketing organization in a global setting with focus on North America and Europe.Experience with B2G sales relying heavily on public procurement processes.Experience in selling both directly and through partners (system integrators, channel partners, agents etc.).Successful experience building a go-to-market strategy and corporate sales plan.Proven success driving consistent revenue growth year-over-year.Experience with solutions consisting of both hardware and software - an advantage.Experience with public safety solutions - an advantage.Experience with cyber security products – an advantage.Great problem-solving skills.Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.Flexible in a dynamic environment.Show more Report

Elementor is the leading website creation platform WordPress, empowering professionals and aspiring creators to create incredible websites.
The Product Marketing team at Elementor sits at a strategic intersection, connecting the product, the users, and the market.
We're looking for an enthusiastic and motivated individual who understands the power of exceptional product marketing.
As a Product Marketing Manager, you'll become an expert on our product, customers, the market, and the competitive landscape.
You'll shape our go-to-market strategy and the future of our product by working cross-functionally with our leadership, marketing, and product teams.
Requirements:

You'll thrive as a Product Marketing Manager at Elementor if you:
Have 3+ years of experience as a product marketing manager
Are a storyteller with innovative and creative skills, and a strong team player
Have a track record in crafting positioning, user segmentation, and packaging new and existing products in the market
Have experience creating high-end marketing collateral across multiple channels
Have experience creating high-detail wireframes and mockups for web pages, emails, product screens, etc
Possess a high degree of design aesthetics, and can guide other stakeholders toward the best results
Have strong proven analytical skills, are data-driven, and are familiar with A/B testing
Able to operate independently across a set of cross-functional partners
Have a background in SaaS, B2C, and or design software industry. Experience with targeting SMBs/mid-market is a plus.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
Work Environment:

What do we do?
Elementor is the leading website building platform for WordPress professionals.
Our vision is to empower web creators - developers, designers, and marketers, with the ability to create their futures one pixel at a time. We provide our users with everything they need to become successful web creators.
A new website is created every 10 seconds using Elementor!
Since we launched in Israel in 2016, we have expanded to more than 150 countries, with more than 12M websites powered by Elementor. More than 8% of all websites around the world are built using Elementor!
How do we do it?
At Elementor, we're building the future of web creation.
We believe in empowering both our employees and our users.
Elementor is a place where you can truly grow professionally and personally.
Creativity, friendship, curiosity, motivation, and professionalism are the driving force behind our journey. We take great pride in Elementor's constant scaling.
Responsibilities:

Partner with our product team to develop, implement and execute a world-class product go-to-market and launch strategy
Develop and communicate Elementor’s value proposition through marketing materials, web pages, emails, product screens, and more, to drive feature adoption, success, and retention
Develop an expert understanding of Elementor’s products, use cases, and the markets in which we compete to drive unique market positioning, messaging & adoption strategies.
Conduct customer interviews/market research and redefine our view of the competitive landscape to influence decisions regarding the roadmap and go-to-market strategy
Work cross-functionally with sales and growth teams to meet revenue and customer goalsShow more Report

CYE is building a data-driven cybersecurity optimization SaaS platform that allows organizations to continuously improve their cyber resilience. Using our platform, organizations can assess, quantify, and mitigate their cyber risk.
At CYE, we understand that the best results are achieved by combining the power of AI with human expertise. That’s why we’ve built a world-class team of cybersecurity experts that augment the power of our platform.
We are looking for an enthusiastic, motivated, and passionate Marketing Operations Specialist to join our growing marketing team.
Responsibilities
Be responsible for all aspects of our marketing CRM.
Manage end-to-end automated marketing campaigns: from ideation, through set up, segmentation, monitoring & QA, and analysis & optimization.
Build a cross-channel experience with several touchpoints, such as emails and social, to create automated, triggered, and transactional programs.
Monitor and analyze ongoing campaigns and end results to deliver recommendations based on insights and troubleshoot when necessary.
Push operations and automation at CYE to the limit: explore best practices, become the MarTech SME, own your role.
Manage all data syncs between sales and marketing systems (mainly Hubspot<>Salesforce)
Monitor and ensure first- (e.g. website, landing pages) and third-party (e.g. directories) content is accurate and up to date (e.g. take down broken links, update company information, etc.)
Optimize the company website for search engines based on keyword research and market insights.
Build reports and dashboards to reflect website traffic and conversions and generate insights to improve the visitors’ experience.
Frequently experiment: execute A/B tests on email concepts, subject lines, content, CTAs, sending times, layouts, and more.
Qualifications
2-3 years' experience in a similar role, working for a global company – B2B experience is preferred.
Hands-on experience with marketing automation platforms (preferably HubSpot and SalesForce).
Strong business and analytical skills to translate business objectives to MarTech.
Understanding of digital marketing, including paid media, email marketing and conversion rate optimization.
Independent self-starter with demonstrated ability to communicate and influence internal stakeholders.
Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously, shift gears, and prioritize to meet schedules.
Organized and detail oriented.
Service oriented.
Excellent project management skills.
Basic knowledge of HTML – advantage.
English – excellent spoken and written; additional languages – advantage.
About us
CYE offers a SaaS cybersecurity optimization platform that combines technology with red team activity to deliver the most comprehensive and contextual organizational security assessments. By quantifying security data, CYE delivers business insights that help businesses make the right decisions about cybersecurity.Show more Report

Experience in HubSpotShow more Report

About Craft.io

Craft.io is revolutionizing product management with an end-to-end platform for product professionals.

With Craft.io, product professionals enjoy a single source of product truth where they create their product strategy and roadmaps, collect and analyze valuable customer feedback, prioritize features and tasks, write specs, and monitor the work of the dev teams.

Thousands of product professionals from companies like SAP, Kimberly-Clark, Danone, Sysco, Novartis, and Marks & Spencer use Craft.io, and we are proud to provide them with everything they need to become better at what they love doing - building and shipping great digital products.

At Craft.io, we work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving, passionate about our product, and live to bring value to our customers consistently. Our work environment is dynamic, innovative, and fun, backed by a solid product, strong leadership, and a well-funded future.
About the Director of Content Marketing role

We’re looking for an experienced content writer, a veteran in creating content for B2B SaaS companies with proven success in creating great content and executing a marketing penetration strategy.

Our ideal candidate is someone who can develop a content strategy, create a content plan and calendar, write great content for a wide variety of marketing materials, and manage freelance content writers.

Bottom line: if you’re a hard worker as well as a visionary, Craft.io may be the right place for you.
What will you actually do?

Become an expert in the Product Management software space, know our competitors, and learn where we can beat them
Play a key role in the Craft.io branding process and positioning
Develop and implement a content strategy
Own and create all Craft.io content and marketing materials
Write a lot of content, both long-form and short-form, such as eBooks, guides, reports, case studies, website content, landing pages, blog posts, ad copy, emails, press releases, articles, and more
Manage content publication cycles, including graphic designers, writers, and web developers
Take the initiative and remain flexible - this is a startup, after all :)
Native-level English - must have
2+ years experience as Content Marketing Manager working for B2B SaaS company - must have
Experience with writing for enterprise software companies as a target audience - must have

Experience with different types of writing: newsletters, customer stories, white papers, etc. - must have
Extremely organized with high attention to detail and a love for being deep in the weeds - must have
Experience communicating with freelance writers, internal stakeholders, and management - must haveShow more Report

A company that is building the future of audio advertising is looking for a Customer Success Manager. It's a startup focused on creating solutions for publishers to unlock the fastest-growing segment of marketing spend, and empowering advertisers to reach mobile audiences at scale.
As a Customer Success Manager, you’ll oversee existing publisher accounts. Through day-to-day communication, you’ll build strong relationships and establish growth and up-sell strategies tailored to your book of business. Additionally, you’ll be responsible for onboarding new publishers, while working with counterparts internally and externally to ensure that all technical and performance issues are resolved quickly and appropriately.
Success in this role is achieved through building strong relationships, up-selling, performance analysis, technical support, and optimization. The strategic partnership manager is expected to actively contribute to the ongoing success of the business while working in close partnership with the sales, product, and R&D.
Job Description:
Communicate and work closely with Advertisers and Publishers worldwide to manage relationships.
Growing revenue from existing accounts and clients.
Performance and technical focal point for product integration, best practices, and overall account operations.
Manage and optimize campaigns; analyze performance and recommend/implement improvements to meet customers’ monetization objectives.
Supporting the sales team in pre and post-sale stages.
Requirements :
Minimum 1-year experience within a global advertising or gaming company.
2 years experience in client management from global operating companies.
English at a native level.
Sales-oriented, strong ability to negotiate.
Strong interpersonal skills to interact with clients, management, and peers.
Ability to multitask and handle various priorities.
Details-oriented with an ability to see the bigger picture.
Passionate for games and knowledge of the gaming industry.
Bachelor degree.Show more Report

We are looking for a data analyst for the Marketing Analytics team of an international game development company founded in 2009, dedicated to creating the best mobile and social experience for hardcore and casual gamers worldwide. With over 250 million registered users, this company is consistently ranked among top game developers.
The company employs more than 1,500 individuals worldwide and is headquartered in Herzliya Israel, with eight offices and development studios across Europe and the United States. The company's games are available on iOS, Android, and all major social networks.
The Business Performance department is in charge of all the analytical aspects of the game operations and strategic planning: From game design to user acquisition, player behavior, live-ops, and game optimization (such as monetization, retention, etc).
The scope of responsibility of this team includes budget optimization for user acquisition for the company's games at the scope of tens of million dollars per game, analysis of game profitability and long term potential, analysis of the players' behavior, player game funnel and reaction to new game features and offers, and many more. The goal is to make sure the company brings the best and most relevant players to its games in the most efficient and effective way.

Responsibilities:
Be an analytical focal point for anything related to UA, New user performance KPIs, monthly budget planning, tests and performance monitoring
Be a focal point for anything related to new players' performance and KPIs across our range of games, strategic planning, user segmentation, tests and growth opportunities identification
Daily support of ongoing analytical needs of the marketing department managers & teams
Establish and monitor success metrics that measure and explain the impact of the marketing activities
Ability to work across multiple data sources in order to research and capture the full activity.
Design and initiate new features and reports to monitor & give insights on the marketing activity, using the marketing in-house BI system (for example, LTV, ROI forecasting, automatic rules)
Collaborate with the game analysis team and the game studios to monitor and optimize the company's players experience, maximizing their retention in the games
Requirements:
At least 2 years of previous experience as a data analyst; additional experience in marketing analytics- A must
Proven experience with measuring online success and identifying optimization opportunities
Excellent understanding of online marketing metrics (user funnel, user acquisition KPI’s)
Experience in researching large amounts of raw data and a technical orientation.
SQL Server and Google big Query experience
High level of proficiency in SQL & Excel (Python - an advantage)
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Qlik Sense
Excellent English communication and presentation skills
Passion for Gaming – an advantage
A/BSc in an analytical field such Statistics, Industrial Engineering or similar from a leading universityShow more Report

This is us
Kaltura’s (NYSE:KLTR) mission is to power any video experience for any organization – live, on-demand, or real-time. We not only want to make using video simpler, but we also want to better people’s lives through video. Founded in 2006, Kaltura is now a global leader in the video market with millions of people using our products daily to teach, learn, watch, connect, and collaborate. Among our customers, you’ll find more than 1000 global, well-known organizations.
15+ years since starting the company, we continue to foster a diverse and collaborative work environment where everyone gets a say. Our team is currently 850+ people, and we’re still growing. We have offices in New York, London, Singapore, and Tel Aviv, but our technology is all in the cloud.
Kaltura has a fast-paced environment where initiative is always encouraged. Together with our hybrid work model and flexible state of mind, you get the right conditions for creative juices to flow freely. Thanks to our long line of products, cultivation of rich collaborative culture and care for each Kalturian, you’ll never run out of room to grow and evolve.
If you don't meet 100% of the requirements below - that's okay, nobody's perfect! We believe in hiring people, not just a list of skills. We encourage you to apply if you think this is a role that would make you excited about coming to work every day.
Requirements:

The role:
As a Product Marketing Manager, you will shape Kaltura’s Go to Market strategy using deep product insights, industry knowledge, and market intelligence. Your deep understanding of the product features and the buying process will drive change in how we market and sell our products. You will dive deep into the data from every buying process step and optimize messaging and customer touchpoints to turn leads into life-long subscribers. You will partner with product managers, marketing, and sales to define Kaltura’s market position and further scale our business.
﻿The day-to-day
Plan products GTM and execute them
Create assets for the sales & CSM teams
Communicate and train customers, salespeople, and CSMs
Conduct market and competitive analysis, user research, focus groups, and surveys
Use data to gain insights and optimize messaging, products, and marketing assets accordingly
Work closely with product, marketing, sales, customer experience, and other departments
﻿Ideally, we’re looking for:
At least one year of experience in product marketing in a Saas company
Experience in a customer-facing role, supporting enterprise sales cycles
Analytical approach and willingness to dive deep into data
Experience working cross-functionally internally to drive results
Superlative written, verbal, and visual communication skills in English
These would also be nice:
Significant advantage: worked with the EDU vertical (higher education)
Knows all about video, RTC, VOD, live, etc.

Hybrid, flexible work environment

Personal and professional development programs
